column4: It doesn't continue running the normal vga bootscreen after Configuring X.. I think it has something to do with that
when I put the cd in another pc, it runs fine
I have the same problem as this guy: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=25193   But there are no solutions there
try this,. ctrl+alt+backspace at once - it will restart the gui - what spec is that box?
that is one nasty card - you really need to follow this
that is the problem are you sure?
how do i install those drivers when i can't get into the system?
you go to a terminal, CTRL+ALT+F1 and log in, the instructions you have are in text so you type them out and bingo - the thing is that its a lot of effort to try this out
one thing you could try is this,
i can't get into a terminal, because ctrl-alt-f1 says: Uncompressing Linux... Ok, booting the kernel
sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg << and there in choose VESA I don't know if that will work Try F2 in that combination up to F7
i get a lot of black screens, but not a normal terminal window
how do i get in a terminal screen?
